Plans.Name: Heart Failure Motivator
Plans.Description:
Heart Failure is a chronic condition in which the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should. Heart failure can occur if the heart cannot pump (systolic) or fill (diastolic) adequately. Symptoms include shortness of breath, fatigue, swollen legs and rapid heartbeat.
Heart Failure care plan helps in managing the condition.

The American Heart Association's National HeartFailure Initiative, IMPLEMENT-HF, is made possible with funding by founding sponsor, Novartis, and national sponsor, Boehringer Ingelheim and Eli Lilly and Company.

Plans.Name: Cholesterol
Plans.Description:
Start your health journey to better manage your high cholesterol and reduce your risk of heart disease and stroke.
You'll learn about healthy lifestyle habits, goal planning, shared decision-making with your care team, cholesterol medications, self-management tips, and health behavior maintenance.
Novartis is a proud supporter of the American Heart Association’s Integrated ASCVD Management Initiative.

Plans.Name: Stroke
Plans.Description:
A stroke occurs when a blood vessel that carries oxygen and nutrients to the brain is either blocked by a clot or bursts (or ruptures).
When that happens, part of the brain cannot get the blood (and oxygen) it needs, so it and brain cells die.
The HCA Healthcare Foundation is proud to be a national supporter of the American Stroke Association’s Together to End Stroke™.
For more information, visit: https://www.stroke.org.

Plans.Name: SMBP
Plans.Description: SMBP plus clinical support can improve access to care and quality of care for people with hypertension while making blood pressure control more convenient and accessible across the population. Clinical support includes regular one-on-one counseling, web-based or telephonic support tools, and educational classes.
